Argentina: Gold is discovered near Cape Virgenes sparking the Tierra del Fuego gold rush
Belgium: North Sea Fisheries Convention (signed 1882) comes into effect.
Jules Malou replaces Walthère Frère-Orban as Prime Minister
Auguste Beernaert replaces Jules Malou as Prime Minister
Chile: The War of the Pacific ends with the signing of a truce with Bolivia. Chile's territorial gains allow the mining of saltpeter in the conquered regions, leading to great national prosperity for Chile. Treaty called "Pacto de Tregua".
China: Battle of Fuzhou: A French fleet destroyed the Qing Fujian Fleet at the mouth of the Min River.
Colombia: Ezequiel Hurtado is President of the United States of Colombia
Rafael Nuñez is President of the United States of Colombia for second time
ETB (company) is created, being the first telecommunications company in Colombia
Germany: Berlin Conference: A conference was convened in Berlin to formalize the practice of territorial claims in Africa by the participating powers Austria-Hungary, Belgium, Denmark, France, the United Kingdom, Italy, the Netherlands, Portugal, Spain, Sweden-Norway, the Ottoman Empire and the United States.
Haiti: Haitian writer Louis-Joseph Janvier publishes the article "L'Egalité des Races", which proclaims the equality of the races
Philippine: Required forced labor of 40 days a year is reduced to 15 days by the Spanish Colonial Government.
Rizal finishes his medical studies in Spain
Rwanda: The Society for German Colonization is formed by Karl Peters in order to acquire German colonial territories in overseas countries. Peters signs treaties with several native chieftains on the mainland opposite Zanzibar.
Sweden: The daily newspaper Svenska Dagbladet is founded.
The Fredrika Bremer Association, Sweden's oldest women's rights organization, is founded.
Taiwan: Keelung Campaign: French forces try to land at Jilong but are forced to withdraw by Chinese troops
Battle of Tamsui: A French attack on Danshui is defeated
Tanzania: The Society for German Colonization is formed by Karl Peters in order to acquire German colonial territories in overseas countries. Peters signs treaties with several native chieftains on the mainland opposite Zanzibar.
